title: Positive externality, MSB greater than MPB

content.question: When consumption of a good generates a positive externality, which of the following must be true at the market equilibrium?

choices.label: Marginal social benefit is less than marginal private cost.
Marginal social benefit is greater than marginal private benefit.
Marginal social cost is greater than marginal social benefit.
Marginal social cost is less than marginal private benefit.
Marginal social cost is equal to marginal external benefit.

content.answer: Marginal social benefit is greater than marginal private benefit.

unit.text: 6: Market Failure and the Role of Government

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Using economic concepts, principles, or models, explain how a specific economic outcome occurs, or what action should be taken in order to achieve a specific economic outcome.
